test_cases.name: Successful E2E Task Creation with Single User, File Upload, and Alignments
preconditions: A valid user account exists with the specified email and password.
The user is associated with the specified company.
The Priority and Huddle to be aligned with already exist in the system.
The file specified for upload exists at the defined local path.
The application is accessible at the Base URL.

test_data.Task_Name: E2E Task with File and Alignments
test_data.Document_Description: This is the final report for the Q4 project.

test_steps.action: Navigate to the Application base URL.
test_steps.expected_result: The login page loads successfully.

test_steps.action: Enter a valid email from the test data and click the 'Continue' button.
test_steps.expected_result: The application proceeds to the password entry screen.

test_steps.action: Enter the corresponding valid password and click the 'Login' button.
test_steps.expected_result: The user is authenticated and the company selection page is displayed.

test_steps.action: Select the specified company name from the list.
test_steps.expected_result: The application dashboard for the selected company loads.

test_steps.action: Click on 'Action Items' in the main navigation menu.
test_steps.expected_result: A submenu with options including 'Tasks' appears.

test_steps.action: Click on 'Tasks' from the submenu.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'Manage Tasks' page is displayed.

test_steps.action: Click the 'New Task' button.
test_steps.expected_result: The task creation form opens.

test_steps.action: Enter the 'Short Task Name' from the test data.
test_steps.expected_result: The task name is correctly entered into the input field.

test_steps.action: Enter the 'Due Date' in MM/DD/YYYY format from the test data.
test_steps.expected_result: The due date is correctly entered into the date picker field.

test_steps.action: In the 'Search or Invite Team Members' field, enter the email of a single user.
test_steps.expected_result: An autocomplete dropdown appears with matching user suggestions.

test_steps.action: Click the matching user from the autocomplete dropdown to assign them.
test_steps.expected_result: The selected user is added as an assignee to the task.

test_steps.action: In the 'Start typing to search Priorities' field, enter an existing priority name.
test_steps.expected_result: An autocomplete dropdown appears with matching priorities.

test_steps.action: Click the matching priority from the autocomplete dropdown to align it.
test_steps.expected_result: The selected priority is aligned with the task.

test_steps.action: In the 'Start typing to search Huddles' field, enter an existing huddle name.
test_steps.expected_result: An autocomplete dropdown appears with matching huddles.

test_steps.action: Click the matching huddle from the autocomplete dropdown to align it.
test_steps.expected_result: The selected huddle is aligned with the task.

test_steps.action: Click the '+' icon next to the 'Documents' section.
test_steps.expected_result: The document upload dialog opens.

test_steps.action: Enter the 'Document Name' and 'Document_Description' from the test data.
test_steps.expected_result: The document name and description are entered into their respective fields.

test_steps.action: Ensure the 'Document_Type' is set to 'File'.
test_steps.expected_result: The document type is correctly set to 'File'.

test_steps.action: Upload the specified 'Document_File' from the local file path.
test_steps.expected_result: The file is selected and appears ready for upload.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Save' button on the document dialog.
test_steps.expected_result: The document dialog closes and the file is listed as an attachment on the task form.

test_steps.action: Click the final 'Save' button to create the task.
test_steps.expected_result: The task is created successfully, and the system navigates back to the 'Manage Tasks' page, showing the new task in the list.

test_cases.name: Verify Successful Task Creation with 'Assign to all Users' Bulk Assignment
preconditions: User is successfully logged in to the application.
User has navigated to the 'Manage Tasks' page.

test_steps.action: Click the 'New Task' button.
test_steps.expected_result: The task creation form opens.

test_steps.action: Enter the 'Short Task Name' from the test data.
test_steps.expected_result: The task name is correctly entered into the input field.

test_steps.action: Enter the 'Due Date' from the test data.
test_steps.expected_result: The due date is correctly entered into the date picker field.

test_steps.action: Locate and click the 'Assign to all Users' checkbox to select it.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'Assign to all Users' checkbox is checked, and the individual user search field may be disabled.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Save' button to create the task.
test_steps.expected_result: The task is created successfully, and the system returns to the 'Manage Tasks' page. The new task is visible and assigned to all users.

test_cases.name: Verify Successful Task Creation with 'Assign to all Admins' Bulk Assignment
preconditions: User is successfully logged in to the application.
User has navigated to the 'Manage Tasks' page.

test_steps.action: Click the 'New Task' button.
test_steps.expected_result: The task creation form opens.

test_steps.action: Enter the 'Short Task Name' from the test data.
test_steps.expected_result: The task name is correctly entered into the input field.

test_steps.action: Enter the 'Due Date' from the test data.
test_steps.expected_result: The due date is correctly entered into the date picker field.

test_steps.action: Locate and click the 'Assign to all Admins' checkbox to select it.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'Assign to all Admins' checkbox is checked, and the individual user search field may be disabled.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Save' button to create the task.
test_steps.expected_result: The task is created successfully, and the system returns to the 'Manage Tasks' page. The new task is visible and assigned to all admin users.

test_cases.name: Verify Successful Task Creation with Multiple Individual User Assignments
preconditions: User is successfully logged in to the application.
User has navigated to the 'Manage Tasks' page.
All users specified in the 'Assigned_To' data exist in the system.

test_steps.action: Click the 'New Task' button.
test_steps.expected_result: The task creation form opens.

test_steps.action: Enter the 'Short Task Name' from the test data.
test_steps.expected_result: The task name is correctly entered into the input field.

test_steps.action: Enter the 'Due Date' from the test data.
test_steps.expected_result: The due date is correctly entered into the date picker field.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Search or Invite Team Members' input field and enter the first user email from the comma-separated list.
test_steps.expected_result: An autocomplete dropdown appears with the matching user.

test_steps.action: Click the matching user option to select them.
test_steps.expected_result: The first user is added as an assignee.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Search or Invite Team Members' input field again and enter the second user email from the comma-separated list.
test_steps.expected_result: An autocomplete dropdown appears with the matching user.

test_steps.action: Click the matching user option to select them.
test_steps.expected_result: The second user is also added as an assignee.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Save' button to create the task.
test_steps.expected_result: The task is created successfully, and the system returns to the 'Manage Tasks' page. The new task is visible and assigned to all specified individuals.

test_cases.name: Verify Successful Task Creation with a 'Link' Document Attachment
preconditions: User is successfully logged in to the application.
User has navigated to the 'Manage Tasks' page.

test_data.Document_Description: External link to the project briefing on Confluence.

test_steps.action: Click the 'New Task' button.
test_steps.expected_result: The task creation form opens.

test_steps.action: Enter the 'Short Task Name' from the test data.
test_steps.expected_result: The task name is correctly entered into the input field.

test_steps.action: Enter the 'Due Date' from the test data.
test_steps.expected_result: The due date is correctly entered into the date picker field.

test_steps.action: Click the '+' icon next to the 'Documents' section.
test_steps.expected_result: The document upload dialog opens.

test_steps.action: Enter the 'Document Name' and 'Document_Description' from the test data.
test_steps.expected_result: The document name and description are entered into their respective fields.

test_steps.action: Click the document type dropdown and select the 'Link' option.
test_steps.expected_result: The dialog UI changes to show a field for entering a URL.

test_steps.action: Enter the 'Document_URL' from the test data into the 'Enter Link...' field.
test_steps.expected_result: The URL is correctly entered into the input field.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Save' button on the document dialog.
test_steps.expected_result: The document dialog closes and the link is listed as an attachment on the task form.

test_steps.action: Click the final 'Save' button to create the task.
test_steps.expected_result: The task is created successfully, and the system returns to the 'Manage Tasks' page. The new task is visible with the link attachment.

test_cases.name: Verify Successful Sequential Creation of Multiple Tasks in a Single Session
preconditions: A valid user account exists for the initial login.
The test data source contains at least two valid and distinct task definitions.
The application is accessible at the Base URL.

test_steps.action: For the FIRST task: Navigate to the Application base URL, enter valid credentials, select the company, and navigate to the 'Manage Tasks' page.
test_steps.expected_result: User is successfully logged in and the 'Manage Tasks' page is displayed.

test_steps.action: For the FIRST task: Click 'New Task', fill out the form with the first task's data (name, due date, assignee, etc.), and click 'Save'.
test_steps.expected_result: The first task is created successfully, and the system returns to the 'Manage Tasks' page.

test_steps.action: Verify the user is still on the 'Manage Tasks' page and is logged in.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'New Task' button is visible, confirming the user is on the correct page and the session is active.

test_steps.action: For the SECOND task: Click the 'New Task' button again, without logging out.
test_steps.expected_result: The task creation form opens for the second task.

test_steps.action: For the SECOND task: Fill out the form with the second task's data and click 'Save'.
test_steps.expected_result: The second task is also created successfully, and the system returns to the 'Manage Tasks' page.

test_steps.action: Verify that both created tasks are now visible in the task list.
test_steps.expected_result: Both tasks appear in the list, confirming successful sequential creation within a single session.
